reviews.text: Informative and  interesting your of early Butte.  Definitely worth the nominal fee.  Tour included entrance to the Brittany mine.
It was very good- lots if history about the city of Butte
Nice info about the town....good little tour...

This is a hidden gem! A must do. You will find out about the history of Butte and lots more things you will want to check it while you are there. The driver is great! Super knowledgeable about the area! This was so much better than expected!

I'm usually not a rock or mineral person, but I was amazed at the collection and information about local and worldwide minerals. It was worth learning of the wide variety of minerals. I'm sure kids will enjoy it if anything for the different types, shapes and colors of the minerals on display. 
I recommend it.

Hidden gem of a museum. I enjoyed the room of fluorescent rocks and we all enjoyed the well maintained displays. It felt a bit dated but full of interesting samples. My rock buff found some lovely things in the gift shop and they were well priced. Bit hidden on the campus.
A great place to see in Butte. If you are into rocks and geology, this is the pace for you. Plan on spending at least a couple hours there.....there is a lot to see!
Tiny museum, but worth the visit.  Obviously about geology and the local area.  Small gift shop with some cool things for the kids.  The giant gold nugget is amazing!
A great place to visit especially for those that are into minerals obviously. But also the science of local geology and Mining. And those just with curious minds. Located on the Montana Tech campus

Better than expected. Some of the exhibits are showing their age, but if you have the time and willingness to explore the whole museum you will have a new found respect for the historical aspect of the mining industry. The underground tour was great, my kids favorite part of the museum.

Lots of fun. Not as scary as I thought it would be,  going down the mine a hundred feet underground. Everything is old, and you could only see the above ground attractions from the outside, but they have some neat stuff. If you like rocks, go to the mineral museum at the Montana tech college.

It was a great experience! An open air museum, you walk through history itself. We took the 100ft tour and it was more than worth it. Our guide Raven was amazing, very knowledgeable and passionate about mines! Would love to visit for more.

We did the 100' tour and it was amazing, we will likely go again in the extended future.  Tour guide and front desk person were extremely nice and knowledgeable.  Nice rock museum and replica mining town to look at.

This was my second time going to the museum. I love the old town they have set up. The first time I was there I did the 65 feet tour which was great. This time I did the 100 feet tour and the tour guide was a volunteer  previous miner, it was amazing! He had great stories and even showed us how the equipment worked. Thank you for the great tour! 
I also liked how they give you a dog tag when you purchase a tour, great souvenir

Great breakfast spot in Butte Montana. Very historic little town with tons of history on the miners. The owner came and talked with us. The veggie Benedict was really good although the hash browns were slightly over salted. Our first option was closed on Monday so we came here and were satisfied. Would recommend. Cool newspaper clippings on the wall

My grandson, daughter, & I went to Gamer's cafe on Wednesday February, 8th 2019. The rare steak was tough & old. The meat on the french dip sandwich was tough & old. The ham was tough & old. The only one that was sent back was the steak. The replacement sausage was good. The hash browns with white gravy that both my grandson & me ate gave us diarrhea and vomiting.  I know it was the hash browns and gravy as we didn't eat the ham or the french dip sandwich.  The next day we went back to tell them about the hash browns.  The manager asked if we went to the hospital and we hadn't.  He then asked what we wanted & we said we wanted nothing just for you to be aware of it. They were surprised as they make new gravy every day. We will never eat there again.
Wonderful friendly service, family owned, fresh made food with fresh local ingredients and large portions. Would highly recommend!

My favorite place to belly up to the lunch counter, and my favorite servers make me feel like I just walked into my own home. 
The owner goes out of his way to say Hello to most everyone in the house.
Delicious food, great atmosphere. Portions are big so kids split a single order.
Amazing as always.. great service with smile. Love the Freeway Tavern
The Wopchops are amazing and I love the atmosphere!
Great burgers. Good prices.
Good food. Friendly service. A total dive bar...my kind of place!
If you want to know exactly what it feels like to be a worthless hick while being fed like a king, this is the place to go. Unapologetic and wonderful people with Wopchops and fries. Perfection

The place is fascinating to see and the view 😍 but the portions for the price is not great. I had the beef brisket which was priced at 16.99 I will post a picture of the portion for that price, and the flavor just wasn't there. I would not recommend.

I had the brisket, my woman had the southwest salad. Waitress was attentive, food was great and came in a timely fashion, cool looking place! Only thing I'd like to see is a little more in the meat portions. There was about 3 bacon sized slices of brisket

A go-to place to eat in Butte. Good food (standard American "cuisine"), some decent dishes, some great dishes. BBQ was Surprisingly good. Service varies as staff is vary variable, but generally most wait staff is kind and helpful. A couple have been great. Cool setting with classic pickup truck as a place to sit, and mid to late 20th century decor.
Food is great! Atmosphere is unique, and the bar is awesome. Don't skip this one if you're in Butte.
Best chicken fried steak in town! Friendly staff, great service.

Our favorite spot for a romantic date. Good portions seem small the first time you go, but you are stuffed by the end of the night. Higher end prices, but completely worth it. Fantastic steaks! Thursday is sushi night with fresh fish as well for those who love seafood.

We showed up without reservations and was seated very quickly.  My 5 year old ordered mac and cheese while I was ordering drinks and his food come out with the drinks. My wife and I thought our dinner was the best we have had.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.  It's my new favorite dining.

This place is nothing short of epic. I make a point of getting here for dinner whenever in the general area. Steaks are to die for. Great soups and salads. I really have nothing to say bad about this place. Been coming here for over 6 years now! Well done - Pun intended!

My buddy recommended Casagranda's so we decided to check it out . We had seven of us and I can't remember the last time I had such a great experience! The place was packed but the service and food were fantastic. Staff was friendly, food quality great and awesome wine list. I will be back!

Perhaps the best steak I've ever had -- and it was reasonable and came with 2 sides. Sit at the bar for the experience. I wasn't a fan of their draft beers, but the wine choices were good and the pour large.

I use to come here for the best steaks around. Great seasoning and quality meat. Today it was lacking. Too salty and the New York had a good chunk of gristle down the center. Good service but quality is not as good.

Very good steak House! I would expect for the prices we paid to be fancier? Waitress and staff were friendly our waitress had to go to the kitchen to answer several questions about the menu so she could have been more knowledgeable about the menu. My New York strip was under cooked had to have it brought back but returned perfect! Overall we'll be back again for a great steak in Butte.

Simple food done very well. There is nothing flashy about the Derby, but they seem to be very consistent. They don't do anything earth shattering, but I always have a good steak and good service. There is no secret sauce or gimmicks, just good food done right consistently. I never hesitate to go to the derby. Price is good, place is clean, and ther's a full bar + you can watch horse races.

The service here was friendly. The Bloody Mary was just spicy enough served with pickled Asparagus, celery, green olive and a pepper! The Rib Eye steak was served hot and juicy - by far the best I've ever had!
Has been way better. Dont know if they got new cooks or what but hasnt been as good as usual.
